battleship.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship.logic.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class handles the placement of ships, and shots.
    Author:
    Hinrich Kaestner, Tom Ohme
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Sets up a new game with predefined field sizes (10x10 fields) and ships

    • Method Detail

      • getNextUnsetShip

        public Ship getNextUnsetShip()
        Returns the first ship in the list that has not yet been set.
        Returns:
        first unset Ship, or null if all ships are set

      • placeShipUser

        public boolean placeShipUser(Ship ship)
        adds a ship to the user field
        Parameters:
        ship - Ship
        Returns:
        true if ship was placed in the user field, false if not

      • placeShotUser

        public Field.Fieldelements placeShotUser(int posX,
                                int posY)
        Places a shot from the user on the computers field.
        Parameters:
        posX - x coordinate of the shot
        posY - y coordinate of the shot
        Returns:
        The new status of the field where the shot was aimed at.

      • placeShotComputer

        public Field.Fieldelements placeShotComputer()
        Automatically places a shot on the gamers field. This algorithm is based on an idea by someone at the TU Munich, Germany, who didn't write his name in the comments of his/her C code.
        Returns:
        The new status of the field where the shot was aimed at.

      • getWinner

        public Game.Playerelements getWinner()
        Determines the winner of a game. The game is over as soon as this method returns a valid player.
        Returns:
        COMPUTER if the computer won, USER if the user won, ERROR if no one has won so far

      • getField

        public Field getField(Game.Playerelements player)
        Returns the user or computer field.
        Parameters:
        player - The owner of the field.
        Returns:
        the owners field

      • getLastShotComputerX

        public int getLastShotComputerX()
        Get the X position of the computers last shot.
        Returns:
        x position of last shot

      • getLastShotComputerY

        public int getLastShotComputerY()
        Get the Y position of the computers last shot.
        Returns:
        y position of last shot
